definition: to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
to fight/fight/war/battle
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: He called it a narrow escape. But it was really a cliff-hanger .
sentences.chinese: 他称之为侥幸逃脱，但那确实让他胆战心惊。

sentences.english: The robberies have chilled the mah-jongg network.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案已经使麻将赌博网络胆战心惊。

sentences.english: Universally terrifying , it is the most dangerous part of the southern route on Everest.
sentences.chinese: 每一处都令人胆战心惊，这是珠峰南线最危险的地段。

sentences.english: So when we got to the railway station I was all a-quiver.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们到达火车站的时候，我们真是胆战心惊。

sentences.english: Is there any creature more fearsome than the shark?
sentences.chinese: 还有什么生物能比鲨鱼还令人胆战心惊的？

sentences.english: Even as compared with Ladakh, NEFA is an alarming sight.
sentences.chinese: 即使与拉达克相比较，这也是个令人胆战心惊的地方。

sentences.english: I avoid traveling in planes because flying terrifies me.
sentences.chinese: 我避免坐飞机，因为飞行让我胆战心惊。

sentences.english: Our roaring guns left the enemy trembling with fear.
sentences.chinese: 我们的隆隆炮声使敌人胆战心惊。

sentences.english: She flinched as she was carried through an angry, jeering crowd.
sentences.chinese: 她胆战心惊地被人抬着，穿过愤怒和嘲笑的人群。

sentences.english: The screams of the wounded and dying were something to instil fear into the stoutest heart.
sentences.chinese: 受伤者垂死者的尖叫，令最勇敢的人都胆战心惊。

sentences.english: Then we dare to crawl into our own bed.
sentences.chinese: 于是我们才胆战心惊地爬上我们自己的床。

sentences.english: The bombing attack struck fear into their hearts.
Guns always gave me the willies.

definition: lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
panic-stricken
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
anxious/panicky
to tremble with fear
to fear/to be terrified
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
to feel terrified/to grow apprehensive
shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
to have one's hair stand on end (idiom)/to feel one's blood run cold
to be alarmed/to be terrified
fearful/apprehensive
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
